Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a significant attempt to suppress free speech online in Australia.
The bill grants unprecedented power to unelected public servants within ACMA to determine what is true or false.
The proposed powers could lead to government overreach and censorship, similar to media suppression in countries like Russia and China.
The bill could inhibit free speech by imposing fines or imprisonment for non-compliance with ACMA's rules.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are broad and could be used to suppress dissenting opinions.
The timing of the bill is seen as politically motivated, coinciding with an important referendum.
Notable Quotes: What the Albanese Government is proposing is the most significant attempt by an Australian Government to suppress free Speech online in this country.
This draconian bill seeks to place unprecedented power and authority into the hands of a group of unelected public servants.
The Disinformation Misinformation bill is a major overreach by 'big government' and is against democracy in Australia.
If passed this will be the most deliberate act of censorship by any western government.
